website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for something more portable, this steel-frame cot fits in its own carry bag.
pros: Heavy-duty steel frame with tough polyester supports up to 300 pounds Removable side table with cup holder
Sleeping area measures 80-inches long by 32 wide
cons: Long, so measure carefully to make sure it will fit in your tent
May wish to add your own mattress

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, simplistic cot that looks more fragile that it actually is.
pros: Includes a side table and a double-zippered carrying bag
cons: Weighs 20 pounds (slightly more than some competitors)
Occasional complaints that the cot is "wobbly

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleep
customer_reviews.text: Suggestions: 1) get the thickest foam pad you can pack 2) save some cardboard from one of your many amazon orders, to pad the feet and protect your tent floor. 3) make d___ well sure it is all the way open before you put weight on it. It does NOT lock open, so it is held open by your weight.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T. Mundy

customer_reviews.title: My Kind of Cot
customer_reviews.text: These cots are exactly what we were looking for. The unfold and fold up easily and they were the perfect length and width. It made a big difference in our camping experience. My husband cut a foam padding to fit and with our sleeping bags on top, it was comfortable and secure feeling. While we did not use the side table, it's nice to have them available if we decide to use them in the future. So much better than air mattresses because we now have the room underneath the cot to store all our camping stuff. All in all it was one of the best buys we've found.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: But this! Great support, no middle bar...easy to fold up.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this got!! Immediately bought another. Sets up really easy. It is weird it doesnt "lock" together but once it is right side up,it's,fine. Comes with a great "end" table. Folds up easily into travel bag. We pair this up with an old queen memory foam topper we cut in half. Never ever using air mattresses again while camping. We also bought 2 recall kid's cots for our boys. But....This cot is wide enough to possibly fit a mom and a kid. Maybe a tiny dad, haha! Depending on how close you can snuggle comfortably. In an emergency or maybe if kid gets scared at night. Love this purchase!!,cannot beat the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: jml

customer_reviews.title: Love it. It takes no assembly whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It takes no assembly whatsoever, but still feels sturdy. I put a memory foam mattress in it and it's very comfy....guest bed
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.  If you appreciate value.
customer_reviews.text: Best $48 I have ever spent. Handles easily my 240 pound frame
customer_reviews.author: Value 1

customer_reviews.title: The metal frame is very sturdy but not the material
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after a few uses. The metal frame is very sturdy but not the material. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used this cot one weekend and was very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: When I had guests, I used this cot one weekend and was very happy with it. This last weekend I needed again, and the central leg broke (this was the 3rd night of use!). The only reason I didn't land on the floor, I suspect, was because I'm petite and weight 130 lbs. Fortunately, I had an air mattress, so I didn't have to sleep on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: AliAlex

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile
customer_reviews.text: Neat design is easy to set up and put away. I used it in the back yard for tanning, but after the about the 3rd time, the whole canvas portion tore away from the sides. Not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: angel63

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: This cot has a center cross piece that lifts one's hips high, and the cloth under one's legs and under one's back sags significantly. If you want to sleep little, and get up with a major sore back, this is the cot for you. Otherwise, avoid it at all costs. I'm really disappointed that Coleman has produced such an inferior product. DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael English

customer_reviews.title: Weak material
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought the cot at the end of July, 2016. And it served me well in a tent at Burning Man. It folds out easily. But this year a few days in it developed a tear in the center front that quickly expanded. I tried sewing it up with rope that barely lasted a few days before the bottom hit the supports. It only has a 1 year limited warranty. I weigh about 190 lbs. if your about my weight or more I'd get one with sturdier fabric and longer warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Enric

customer_reviews.title: Toot-er Style Bed
customer_reviews.text: The cot brought endless hilarity and potty humor to our recent family vacation. Every time that our oldest son rolled over in bed, we were greeted with the most intense and consistent flatulence known to man. This cot makes the loudest and funniest farting noises ever. Our family laughed every night—it never gets old. Sadly, we did not purchase this cot for comic relief. Rather we were looking for an additional sleeping area. No one in the room can sleep when someone is on this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Different but easier set up than most cots, not as firm
customer_reviews.text: Not quite assembled like a classic cot, you unfold it and prop it up like a camping chair, your distributed weight stretches it out and stabilizes, rather than having bars on the head & foot that hold it open & taught. Because of this, more curved surface than flat & firm like most cots. Disappointed this wasn't obvious or explained in the description, but the cot's decent for using a couple times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: turns out it is a minimum of 20 inches tall which is completely useless to me
customer_reviews.text: This cot is listed to be 17 inches tall. I had measured my tent and was planning for this exact height. However when I received the item and tried to fit it in my tent it was absolutely too big. After measuring it, turns out it is a minimum of 20 inches tall which is completely useless to me. False advertising is not appreciated; buy something else that has accurate measurements listed.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Fox

customer_reviews.title: After purchasing many other brands I was initially impressed with ...
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing many other brands I was initially impressed with the cot construction. However after ordering a second cot it ripped after one overnight camping trip. When folding it up to go home the material ripped over the center joints. Of course it's past the return date so now I guess it just goes in the trash. This is the first review I have ever written on Amazon after at least a hundred purchases and it's only because the product failed so miserably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open and unstable.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like at all. Too difficult to set up. You turn it over to pull legs out and when you try to flip it the middle pulls in the sides and it is quite annoying and heavy. Don't get unless you have two people using. I have this sitting against a wall because will not fight with it. Had someone sleep on it and it also moves on hardwood flooring. The legs are not sturdy. What is required is some type of LOCKING MECHANISM TO SECURE THE LEGS.
customer_reviews.author: mdj

customer_reviews.title: Great for longer camping gataways
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my son and I. I got one then I immediately returned the inflatable mattrices and purchased a second one. I personally put a 3" memory foam on it for extra comfort bc I can't sleep on hard surface. My son used a yoga mat and said it was comfortable. This cot is kind of heavy Its difficult to backpacking with it which we didn't attempt. It's very stardy and won't make too much noise when you turn around. You can't store plenty of items underneath and I really love the "nightstand". Great addition to our camping gear
customer_reviews.author: Ana D.

customer_reviews.title: not a good idea.
customer_reviews.text: Very hard!!! I read reviews and purchased as people said it was great. My family was coming home for the holidays and I needed an extra place to sleep people...I was so disappointed. People were sleeping on the sofa and floor rather than this cot. They avoided it like the plague. I asked to return it and they return shipping cost is half of the purchase price. I got the worst end of this deal. Shame it did not sleep as well as everyone said.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade from air mattress
customer_reviews.text: Used it this weekend after switching from an air mattress. What an upgrade! I'm a larger guy and the air mattresses seemed to always deflate on me over night no matter what I tried. Plus, as I get older it's more difficult to get up off the ground. The cot is a great height to sit and tie your boots before heading out. The side table was a nice addition. I will probably add a foam pad of some sort but the cot itself is great!
customer_reviews.author: Toddp

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with 4+ holes in canvas.
customer_reviews.text: 1. The cot arrived with holes in the canvas - likely punctures from folded leg assembly. 2. Also not sure if legs lock into place when set up. No instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Close to Boston

customer_reviews.title: Great all around; don’t buy “used”
customer_reviews.text: Great quality given other brands/pricepoints. You’ll love not having extra loose pieces to attach. Folds out/folds in. Very stable & sturdy, & the li’l clip-on table (for either side) is well-designed & is no joke. Bought “Used-Very Good” one first to save $, but it had a hole in canvas, & other fresh holes beginning to develop, so switched out for new one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle@Austin

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but sent it back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I'd read reviews about other cots being flimsy and tearing easily. This is definitely heavy duty, wide, and thick material. However, it's a bear to fold and is just plain heavy. I think the shipping weight was 20 pounds, so subtract the weight of a box to get the weight of the cot. Plus it came with a 1/2" tear in the center of the fabric which has to be a fluke because the rest of the material is so heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Piper Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great night sleep at home or abroad.
customer_reviews.text: After I sold my house and moved into a temporary apartment, I got an air mattress. That lasted about 3 months. So, I got this awesome cot. It is one of the most comfortable things I have ever slept on, including some real mattresses. It is definitely long enough, and just wide enough to allow one to roll over without flopping off the side. Supports well, is higher off the ground than I expected it to be, and easy to set up (can do so in the dark). It now serves as secondary sleeping arrangements for surprise guests, which usually ends with them getting a good nights sleep, and then ordering one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great cot, horrible bag!
customer_reviews.text: The cots are very comfortable! I bought two of them. I have a bad back and my back did not bother me at all in this cot. We slept in them for 7 nights in the Adirondacks. The only reason I gave them a 4 star and not a 5 is because the bags are cheep. I've literally only used them on one trip. I took the cots out to inspect them packed them, packed them up for vacation then put them into my tent and took them home and both bags already ripped where the legs rub against fabric on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID S PAYNE

customer_reviews.title: Good quality as all Coleman products are
customer_reviews.text: Good quality as all Coleman products are. Kept us off of the ground in the tent. Loved the added side table for my battery operated fan and water. The only complaint I have - and it may be just me is that when you move it creaks loudly. But other than that it's great to sit on to reach in your bags on the floor of a tent or whatever. I also have them when i fill the beds in my house and need somewhere for additional people to sleep. They are very long and can fit a tall person. A little heavy, but that's because of the quality materials. All in all, i recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Addict

customer_reviews.title: Large, comfortable, and very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is building a house in the mountains, and most nights he sleeps up there, so he can work later and not have to worry about taking the icy mountain roads home. He was using an air mattress, but it got pierced with something and deflated. I wanted to get him a cot, and I bought this one based on the reviews. I love it! It sets up pretty instantly, and it's actually very large and comfortable. I bought two of another, less expensive cot for our sons, but this one is so much nicer and easier to set up. This is exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: DesertMom

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it’s set correctly
customer_reviews.text: Please please please be careful!!! My scout set it up (at night, when tired and in the rain - so all the prerequisites) last night. He has POTS and some back issues so this was how we were going to help. We purchased this a few years ago and finally found it after a move to use! First use, scout got on it and it collapsed in. He may not have set it up correctly, we’re honestly not sure. But please make sure you do set it up correctly, my son is now very sore, having a hard time moving and probably has a cracked or bruised tailbone. Be careful :)
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and compact
customer_reviews.text: We are really impressed with these cots!! We have been trying different sleeping options that will fit in our vehicle and actually work. Our family just grew to 7 and we have very limited space for packing for camping trips. These fold up slim and are very comfy. They are lightweight. We did use those self inflating pads on top, just because we had them but they would work great without them. They set up easy and don't collaspe, even on uneven ground. My husband is a big guy 6' and 245 lbs and still got a good night's rest. Also our cots were delivered in less 24 hrs, even though we did the free 2 day shipping option.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen  Amon

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but you need to be careful
customer_reviews.text: The cot is sturdy once it is fully extended, but be careful when you collapse it. I’ve only used the cot a handful of times and the most recent time I closed it, one of the elbows/hinges caught on the cot fabric and ripped it. I haven’t used it since so I can’t speak to the strength of it after the tear. It’s a good cot, just take care opening and closing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money, even for big guys.
customer_reviews.text: I am a 6'6" tall, 250 lb guy with a history of back problems. I slept on this product 5 consecutive nights after long days of walking and carrying camping gear. I can't say that it's comfortable, but I WILL say that it did NOT aggravate my back problems and it supported my weight without issue. YMMV. The side table is a nice perk.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Grace

customer_reviews.title: I like it but the added weight has me take it ...
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old metal-framed cot this one is quicker to set up and take down and the carry bag is well-sized (not so snug as to make getting the cot into it a struggle). It's also wider which adds comfort and sits higher off the ground making it easier to store items underneath. The only real downside is that it's heavier than the old cot. I like it but the added weight has me take it down to 4 stars. But that wouldn't stop me from buying another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Side table-cool! Setup-super easy. Quality-we’ll see.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent product. Seriously easy setup. Not green. Very clearly gray...not sure why that would matter to anyone though. Legs don’t lock so there is some movement. I’m a little concerned about quality. I had to return the first one because it came with a rip in the fabric. The replacement order showed up with the plastic plug part that fits into the metal tubing at the fold joint already out of the tube and crushed when I took it out of the bag upon delivery. Not sure the trouble of returning a second one is worth it at this point. Side table is pretty darn cool though and can be attached on either side.
customer_reviews.author: kelly a conn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gear!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is rock solid, sturdy, and well made. We trust the Coleman brand and this cot did not disappoint. Sure beats a thin camping pad and even an air mattress IMO. You could even dress this up with a foam pad and really have something great. Unfolding is easy, almost one handed. It's a little awkward to gold up tbh, but maybe I just need to get the hang of it. Well worth it and doesn't take up much extra room in your tent (assuming you have a big enough tent for a cot) since you can store bags and whatnot under it.
customer_reviews.author: Garrison Householder

customer_reviews.title: A nice, sturdy affordable indoor or outdoor cot
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was a bit hesitant about purchasing a cot. Sleeping on a couch takes a bit getting used to. It sure was for me. Finally settled on this Coleman packaway cot. At $50, I decided to buy it. So far, sleeping on it is quite comfortable. It only took me a day or two to get used to sleeping on the cot. My cot will only be used indoors so it should last a long time hopefully. Unfolding it is easy. Haven't done that yet. So far, I love this cot. It's worth the money, definitely.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. James

customer_reviews.title: This could be a very nice cot, but............
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, a rivet on two legs, one on each end was broken. I was leaving on an extended camping trip the next day, so, with no time to return and replace, I had to buy a couple of bolts to repair it. The cot is fairly comfortable, and the side table is nice, but the fact that the legs don’t lock open is a MAJOR problem. That makes it a real pain to move, since it collapses when you lift it to set it where you want it. I really don’t understand why Coleman would make a cot like this. I’m still considering returning. It.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Neidhardt

customer_reviews.title: Great portable bed
customer_reviews.text: Closed, it was somewhat heavy. Open, it was larger than I was expecting but you can reference the description. When I thought cot, I thought low to the ground but this is closer to the height of an actual twin bed. For as big as it gets, it stores small. Intuitive set up, very portable. My son was surprised he found it so comfortable (he laid on it for most of a couple of days as he had fever). The detachable cup holder surface is a great "bedside table."
customer_reviews.author: Leslie K

customer_reviews.title: Very firm!
customer_reviews.text: This cot is exactly how it is described. It sets up easily and is good quality. However, I found it too firm too sleep on. By "too firm," I mean the canvas is stretched so tight and solid there is no give at all--it's almost like sleeping on a wooden table. Maybe I'm just too old--you might like it. I just need something a little softer. I used it for a three night trip and a two night trip. The next trip I went back to an air mattress. Also, it is heavy to carry--it weighs more than my Coleman 6-person instant Tent (which I love!).
customer_reviews.author: Juglr

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I watched a YouTube video before purchase to make sure I was getting what I wanted. For the price, this is an amazing cot. For camping, travel, or a guest spare. Very easy to fold/ unfold. My 6 year old did it solo. Stores easily in a trunk, large suitcase, closet, etc. Doesn't really move when sleeping on it at all. No bars that dig into you. Side table is also sturdy, and removable. It stands as high as a regular twin bed, making it easy to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Cristen Hoagland-Easton

customer_reviews.title: Great Cots!
customer_reviews.text: We looked at a lot of cots before settling on this model and we bought two for a long trip through the SW, visiting 8 national parks while tenting. These are GREAT. Super easy set up, fairly small when stowed. Super comfy and beats the heck out of sleeping on uneven ground or rocks and sticks. I am 250+ and they are very sturdy and easily handle my weight and size. You really can't go wrong with these. Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Hogzilla

customer_reviews.title: The reason I am giving this 4 star vs 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am giving this 4 star vs 5 is because the legs don't lock with a lock. They lock in place by your weight. We have only had one instance where it collapse in the middle of the night when my 8 year old daughter turned over in her sleep. We are hoping it was just not pushed into the lock position and not a problem that will keep reoccurring.
customer_reviews.author: AJAJ2005

customer_reviews.title: Good, but incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Like the cot, but wasn't complete. Missing the little side table. I weigh 255# and the cot is more than sturdy, with a light pad it will be an excellent piece of gear for my guard trips.
customer_reviews.author: D10

customer_reviews.title: Loved it while camping and very comfy with foam added but does take up extra space in tent.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I loved the extra width and length the cot provided for camping. We both have back issues so I added budget twin foam pads and cut them down to fit the cot which made it extra comfortable. I used twin-sized Jersey cotton sheets which fit just fine around the foam and cot. It was easy to fold out/up and it fit just fine in the provided bags. We used an 8 person tent and only 3 of these oversized cots would fit so you would need a bigger tent if you want more than 3 of these sized cots.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Legs do not lock
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the legs didn't have a locking mechanism. It felt very unstable while sitting on it because it seemed to rock front to end. I felt the need to have someone lay on it while I spread the legs to make it feel more stable. But I'm not sure how to do that when I am camping alone. The quality is good as expected from Coleman, so I'm probably being generous with my stars.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Petersen

customer_reviews.title: easy set up
customer_reviews.text: easy set up. great for heavier folks. I am not. The canvas is so hard to me I have to put a mat on top and the legs tend to move around when I move on the bed. The legs are hard for me to keep fully extended sometimes. (It doesn't collapse with me on it....just takes some effort and watchfulness to be sure it stays flat like it should.) This may not be an issue with a heavier person. I'm just over 100lbs. It seems to be well made and sturdy but is HEAVY to haul around and takes up a lot of space in a vehicle trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cot for big person in big tent which will hold up
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews complaint about size and weight of the cot. Great big cot for larger person in larger tent. This cot is big that’s why I bought it. It’s in a 9 person cabin tent because the cot is big. It can hold 300 lbs. that’s why I bought it. Yes it is very comfortable. Setup is easy, no it doesn’t lock, just read directions and use common sense. If you read the description all your questions are answered. This is not for a two person pop up. It’s for camping in a larger tent. Yes it’s a little over 20 lbs but that makes it sturdy. If you want a comfortable cot for a larger person buy This cot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Novice campers and we LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: Add a pad to this cot, and you will sleep like a baby. Comfortable, decent height from the ground, and that gimmicky nightstand attachment is a lifesaver for phone, earrings, etc. After using these for a couple nights "in the wild", we agreed they are more comfy than an air mattress and a lot less trouble. We rarely run out of beds at home, but when we do, we'll set these up instead of the inflatables. Stow a bag underneath and have a place to sit. One caveat--these are heavy. For car camping only you don't want to carry one far!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cot,  but very firm.
customer_reviews.text: This car is very easy to set up. I absolutely love this side table that you can put on it. That’s an excellent addition to the cot. The materials seem very sturdy and well-made. The only complaint I have is that the car is very hard for sleeping. I put a foam mat on it and it was still hard so I put two foam mats on and it was tolerable. I love that it folds up into such a compact bag. Easy to store under a bed or to pack for camping. So there’s a lot of pluses for this cot. Just be aware that it’s very very firm.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cot
customer_reviews.text: This cot sets up and tears down in seconds. It is big and comfortable. The night stand attachment is super handy. I bought this to speed set up of camp when I am only staying a night somewhere and compared to inflating and deflating an air mattress it really fit the bill. Cheaper cots all have those annoying end bars you have to install, this does not. I expect to get many years use out of this sturdy well designed camping bed.
customer_reviews.author: Boxter

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Solid build overall. Frame seems capable of lasting and the material has held up to multiple uses. The one big drawback that has required customization to overcome is the resulting rise in the middle. This minor variance in the middle creates a very noticeable pressure point. To alleviate this, custom "feet" were created for the ends to raise them about 1/4" to offset this. The added benefit is extra protection for tent floors by spreading the weight of the feet across a wider area.
customer_reviews.author: ChKo

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable camping bed!
customer_reviews.text: After couple times bad luck with air mattress, I finally decided to buy this bed. It is very sturdy and comfortable for everyone in my family to sleep on. The best part is that when we were camping, the bed is so easy to move to outside of the tent to take a nap during the summer day. The only thing I don’t like is that it could damage your tent or hardwood floor if you don’t wrap anything around the foot. Overall, I am very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jadesw

customer_reviews.title: Product appears to have been used...
customer_reviews.text: When the cot came it looked like it had been sat on on both ends and in the middle. It's pretty apparent it's been opened and used by someone multiple times. Luckily it appears fairly clean but I am very disappointed in this. I need it tonight for camping so I don't have time to ship it back and get a new one. Shame on the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen H. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Great for big & tall men
customer_reviews.text: This cot was a key purchase in being able to camp with my husband, who is 6'6" 280lbs. My girls and I were always trying to get him to go camping, but his back has been a main issue in this dream. We bought this cot to elevate him off the ground and combined it with the Thermarest Mondo King self-inflating pad, and this setup was better than any bed I've slept in. It's very sturdy and easy to setup. I bought myself a cheaper cot, since I'm 110 and it's noticeably better than my cot in terms of material and stability. If you're on the fence, this is a great buy when combined with a mattress pad.
customer_reviews.author: OurFamilyHikes

customer_reviews.title: They set up very easy which is nice
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these cots when our daughter came home with her family. We used them when we went to see them. They set up very easy which is nice, but they are hard to sleep inn. I woke up a lot with back pain and did not sleep well on it. Our daughter have us a few of our grandsons blankets for more cushion which did help a little. If you get these make sure you have extra padding for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Beats the Floor
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality cot which we use for extra beds when a lot of company is staying at our house. This is the second one we've purchased, and so far they've been durable and are easy to set up and take down. Not the most comfortable night's sleep, but it beats the floor. I like that it has a detachable shelf with drink holder for our guests to set something on. A+
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and solid
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of camping as a Scout leader. I was looking for something to get me up off the floor and still offer some comfort. This Pack away cot is great. It is actually very comfortable. The accessory table is a nice addition. Unfolding and packing is a breeze. My only caution is that at 80 inches long it might be too long for some tents. I'm six feet and 250. Held me just fine felt very solid.
customer_reviews.author: fbhfour

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 300lb dude and this thing held up like a champ. The side table is a nice touch. Leaves a good place to keep your phone and a drink. Also a side benefit is being able to put your bags and/or tools under the cot if you’re in a confined space like a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Aiwa

customer_reviews.title: Great cot!  Wiggles a little.
customer_reviews.text: I compared this to a Cabela’s cot that was a similar size and design. This one was half the price of the Cabela’s one, is much lighter and folds up smaller. It’s very comfortable and I really like the side table. A large yeti cup fits down inside nicely. The only drawbacks are that the outer legs don’t snap into place so it’s a little awkward setting it up, but not a big deal. Also, it moves a little bit front to back a little, which is also not a big deal. It’s plenty sturdy overall. I would highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Vman

customer_reviews.title: She had a horrible time with it
customer_reviews.text: If price is your only consideration then purchase this cot, but if you want one to function well find something else. I purchased this cot for my 13 daughter to take to camp. She had a horrible time with it. It collapsed every night and she woke up in some misshapen way with her head down or her feet down. It was awful. We tested it out at home one night before to be sure we could set it up properly and I questioned at the time that it didn't have any locking mechanism for the legs. I should have listened to my gut. This purchase was a total waste.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great Cot !
customer_reviews.text: I loved this cot. I used it on an all girls weekend for three nights . It’s so easy to open up and fold . Very sturdy even on uneven ground . Definitely recommend. I didn’t use padding but instead placed my sleeping bag on top and it worked perfectly. I also used the space underneath to store all of my stuff which saved space in my tent . I will be purchasing another one for my husband for our family camping trips for sure .
customer_reviews.author: Heather Leard

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this cot!
customer_reviews.text: Despite that the cot doesn’t latch in the middle, it doesn’t cave in and quite sturdy. Holds my 220 pound husband no problem. We did buy a small inflatable mattress to put on top. Comfortable cot but even better with thin single mattress. It is longer and wider than most cots in the market. So if you’re looking for more compact, this is not for you. A little heavy to carry in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to your leaky air mattress!
customer_reviews.text: We finally decided to upgrade to cots for our summer camping trips and I couldn't be happier with these! No more bulky air mattress and waking up every time my husband moves. We both slept great on these and it's so nice to have the little side table to keep a water bottle and our flashlight easily accessible. They are quick and easy to set up and take down. I'm very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: leochoco317

customer_reviews.title: It came broken
customer_reviews.text: This was broken when we got it. I didn't open the package until we got to where we were camping, and one of the pins in the middle leg that supports the whole thing was broken! Thankfully my mother in law went to a home improvement sore and found a screw skinny enough and small enough to work during the week we were gone. As far as usage, it worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Elkins

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy cot. It was easy to unfold and refold. Fits easily into the (included) travel bag. It also has a side tray for a drink and cellphone, remote or what have you. I'm pleased with the quality of this purchase. Of course, time will tell, but it is warranted for (only) one year. I won't be using it every day, so I expect it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: spaceman

customer_reviews.title: Roomy camping cot
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman camping cot is very comfortable and well built. It is wider than expected, so I have not used the side tables. It's a little tricky setting up and flipping it over, but not difficult to figure out. They're heavy- I wouldn't want to carry them any great distance. But if you're looking for a comfortable, sturdy cot, this is the one. Great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: SandyM

customer_reviews.title: If you buy two, test BOTH before you count on it
customer_reviews.text: We bought two and tested one in the house before leaving for our weekend camping trip. It was a little wonky getting the legs stable, but we did and it was as comfortable as I expected. Pretty comfy. We went camping and the other one had a broken leg weld so it wasn’t useable! Returning both as I fear poor workmanship coming into play again.
customer_reviews.author: Dove

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic addition to your travel gear
customer_reviews.text: I slept on it last night to test it and I was very impressed with it. The set up is beyond easy and the material is really good. At times when I turned around while sleeping on it I thought it was going to retract but it never happened so I assume that's not a problem. However I recommend putting something on top of it when sleeping on it to make it comfier, but even without you are able to get a good night rest. I'm about 5' 5" and I have plenty of space except in terms of the width; but that is expected as this is meant to fit inside tents.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Overall, nice cot
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to assemble and comfortable for the average build. My only complaint is that the legs don't lock, they rely on the weight of the individual to stay in place. You have to be careful how you move or the legs at the head and/or feet will collapse inward on you. Lightweight and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Phinfan114

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely get several!
customer_reviews.text: I just used it and it was also my first camping experience using something different than an air mattress. At first it seemed like it didn't lock and would be unstable when sitting, however as long as you sit towards the middle its great. It is high enough for you to store everything underneath it including a large suitcase. Super easy to get on and off it. Its very comfortable and folds easily into a zip bag for packing. My friends had these huge cots that looked great but they were difficult to set up and really bulky for transport and storing and they paid twice what I did! I am going to buy two more.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got this after reading many, many reviews. After sleeping on several different aerobeds and most of the time waking up on the cold floor, I decided to look into cots. I am glad I did! This opens conveniently right into a cot without hassle. I slept nicely with a yoga mat over the top - no poking or squeaking. I wish I had found this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Very easy setup, a bit heavy but that just adds to the quality. Very roomy and supportive, I slept on it without a mattress pad but I can see how that would add to the comfort. A bit noisy moving around on it in the middle of the night but definitely manageable and I'll break it in eventually. Very comfortable though and nice to be off of the ground in case it rains and to avoid creepy crawlies. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Kind of large, decent
customer_reviews.text: Just be aware that this cot is kind of big. Other than that the way it opens, I like and dislike at same time. I like how its a very simple open and stretch out to put together. What I dislike about that is it feels like you are often times having to push down on it to fully open it or you feel like it could cave in on you. It has never done that, just prefer a more simple mechanical feature even if it means connecting pieces to feel secure but thats just me. Otherwise its fine, it was just big for a 4 person tent compared to our other 2 cots.
customer_reviews.author: peteike

customer_reviews.title: Good cot for a big man
customer_reviews.text: Nice cot. I am 6'3, 245#, and it is OK. I little foam pad will make for a more comfortable night's sleep. The attachable nite stand is not a gimick. It is nice. Has a place to hold a 12oz water bottle, a book, phone, etc.. Also it is easy to fold and unfold. Slips right back into the carrying case. It is sturdy, so it is kinda heavy.. Got mine from Amazon for $39. Went to order another and they are $60. Looked around and found a twin pack for $70.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Sad there were small holes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for a scout camp out. It’s getting cold at night so wanted him up off the ground. He liked it a lot and thought it was comfortable. He was super excited there was a side table. I would give it a 5 star rating if it wouldn’t have come a day late and with 2 small holes in it when unboxed. It caused no problems now but eventually I believe it will wear through. I didn’t have time to make other arrangements and send it back so he used it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Holly L

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these instead of air mattresses so that they would last forever. Really pleased with this product, slept on them for a full week and was very comfortable, I mean it's no bed but in contrast to sleeping on the floor or on a deflating air mattress this is a great option! Easy to put away in the mornings and would be great for camping trips. Loved having the side table to keep my phone on at night.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall people
customer_reviews.text: I like to sleep on my side and I'm 6'1" tall so I wanted a bigger cot. This cot is perfect for me. I also love the side table. I keep my water bottle in the holder and charge my cell phone on it as well. The only drawback is it is a little noisy when rolling around on it. I would have expected this to stop after a few uses, but hasn't. Not a huge deal for my since I camp with ear plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Sean K

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cot. Bought it for hurricane nights.
customer_reviews.text: In Florida. Was tired of stupid air mattresses that always ended up leaking air. Got this for when there is a hurricane and I need to sleep in living room. Due to large tree over bedroom. It's super easy to un fold. Then fold back up. My wife was able to do it very easily. It is a little heavy. Super comfy. I tested it with a sleeping pad for camping. Slept great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Riedl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Solid Cot that is great for taller people
customer_reviews.text: This cot is awesome! Supports are steel and its very comfortable for me at 6' 2". Its heavy but I'm not docking points for that since this is built to last and is not sold as a model for storing in a hiking pack. Reminds me of a cot I used growing up on many trips and I expect this unit to last many years on campouts and excursions. My daughter wants me to order her one too! The optional side cup holder is nice, you could also support a tablet on it and watch a movie if you wanted. 5 stars for a solid cot as long as you dont mind that it weighs quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Noisy cot!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a tear in fabric. Most likely due to the Large box it was shipped in. Once set up, the fabric makes this squeaking sound on the steel rails when you move around on it. Yes, it is very easy to set up. Oh, one more thing...... it’s heavy! If your “truck” camping, it’s fine..... but don’t think about packing this thing! Way too big for motorcycle camping......
customer_reviews.author: Pam Protheroe-Morison

customer_reviews.title: Great budget cot
customer_reviews.text: I like the cot due to easy setup and easy storage. It packs up long and thin in the trunk of car. You can make a layer of cots in the trunk without being round and bulky like others. The length and strap helps me carry the cot and a foldable chair on the same shoulder. Comfort is ok for lighter people or kids. The last point is that you won’t hit a knee on a crossbar.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Crichton

customer_reviews.title: Great little cot, perfect for camping or sleepovers
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought 2 of these for my kids to use when camping or during sleepovers. They have slept on it many times and really like the cots, they especially love the little side table. They keep a water bottle and a little camp lantern on them. Originally my wife and I were going to get more expensive cots, we even tried 2 cots that were in the $100 range. We liked these coleman cots much better and ended up returning the expensive ones and getting 2 more of these. They are very easy to set up and don't rock at all when laying on them. For us they do everything we need in a cot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Buit tough, just add some padding on top and expect some weight. Better than an air mattress for this disabled person.
customer_reviews.text: They do the job. They are very heavy but I hope that means they will stick around. Better than being on the ground. I have 2 failed spine fusions and rarely camp now as I just can't. However, these with added padding on top make it bearable. I can't say I am comfortable or out of pain but they are better than air mattresses and I can do a night out on them. They fit in the bags great and I really can't complain except the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Cosgringo

customer_reviews.title: As someone who is 6ft 3in this is a good length. The only thing I would change would ...
customer_reviews.text: Was much larger and sturdier than I anticipated. As someone who is 6ft 3in this is a good length. The only thing I would change would be the design of the legs, they don't really snap into place - they are held there by pressure. If you don't have them fully extended the structure rocks back and forth a little bit. This may be a result of user error or because it's still very new.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M. Diffenderfer

customer_reviews.title: Happy camper!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 cots and I used them for our camping trip. I am extremely pleased with this product. I placed both cots next to each other and placed an air mattress on top. Altogether it worked out great. We slept very well in our tent. My husband and me aren’t slim people, so the cots are very sturdy. I’m happy with this purchase. These cots are easy to set up and fold as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chica28

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: No problems whatsoever. An eight-year-old granddaughter slept on it for 10 nights and she adored it, was even eager to go to bed! Although we were in a house, she pretended she was camping. Very easy to set up, perfectly comfortable with a foam rubber mattress to keep the cool air out from underneath. It's easy to put back in its bag, unobtrusively ready for the next big crowd. It takes up very little storage space. An adult could easily have slept on it: the size was fine and the comfort was very good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Casini

customer_reviews.title: Second Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much I purchased a second one! Don't listen to the reviews that say it is makes a lot of noise when you turn over. I am going to imaging if that is the case it may have to do with a weight restriction on this. I have had no problems. Perfect for camping or for guest sleep over. More comfortable than expected and I love how compact it is compared to other cots.
customer_reviews.author: All about reviews

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely could not be more pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely could not be more pleased with this purchase!!!!! We’ve used this cot about 8 times now! My daughter has friends over and this has come in very handy! She went to a softball tournament and there was a bunch of girls in one room- a bunch of people ended up sleeping on the floor- but I sent Her w this cot and she was all set! Another great thing is- it folds up and has a bag it goes into and it doesn’t take up a lot of space in the trunk - but best of all - it’s super simple to set up !!!!! I’m buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: Liedtke Family

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and way better than the cots provided to us
customer_reviews.text: I work for a public service agency and we had to work a 24 hr shift due to hurricane Matthew, this baby came in right on time (tks to amazon prime). It's durable, comfortable and way better than the cots provided to us. I loved the side table, it helped me a lot due to very limited space to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Love the ease of setup and breakdown
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered three of these cots. Love the ease of setup and breakdown. Of the three ordered, one came with a tear in the fabric so it was returned. A word of warning, when folding the cot the fabric must not be allowed to drape over the hinged bars, with that much leverage the fabric will rip. I have over 200 nights of use on my first cot and, with the exception of the fabric tear which we patched, love the cot.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good sleep alternative for guests
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably portable cot, of good length/width. Unfortunately the legs don’t lock in place in any way, so it is a bit unstable. But there are no crossbars in uncomfortable locations and it has the right amount of give to be comfortable without sagging. The side table is a nice feature but usually not used so a bit superfluous.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Wilson

customer_reviews.title: okay and strong
customer_reviews.text: Im 180lbs male 34 year old male with not the best back, but for me this definitely needs padding like at least 2 inches of padding for this to be really enjoyable. Otherwise very quiet (no creaky sounds), medium weight, good product.However I will looking for a cot that includes padding built in but if you just want a reliable sturdy cot this one is fine.
customer_reviews.author: swimmerboy6

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COT
customer_reviews.text: Great Cot for those special times when you either run out of beds or need to take one with you. Oversized, which is just as well, since I am too. You might want to include a bit of foam or support to help out, but the cot itself works great. We bought two for holiday overflow and were very pleased. They fold easier than any cot and fit effortlessly into the carry bags. They are a bit heavier, but that only reflects how well made they are.
customer_reviews.author: Thom Tex

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what they offer
customer_reviews.text: This cot is easy to pitch and tear down. No real fuss. It fits and holds me a 5'6" male without issue and fits in the corner of the closet when it isn't needed.
customer_reviews.author: javi

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a good cot!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a pretty good cot! The lil table is nice to have! I used a light foam mattress(about 3" thick that you can pick up at any fabric store) to lighten the "summer camp feel. Folds up nicely for the size. If they came up with one a bit bigger I'd buy it in a second! It also was quite handy when my buddy and his wife had a bit of a rumby! Lol!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Easy Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Working great for our young daughter on trips, she's thrilled and comfortable. Easy as can be, just be sure when you fold it up you have the canvas out of the way of the legs. In other words, don't force it. If you feel resistance when folding the ends up like a taco, move the canvas. Not hard. Opens in seconds. Easy to put back into the carry case. The tray is simple. It will fit you, too, unless you are really tall. Thank You, Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Powdernut 75

customer_reviews.title: Best with Air Pad
customer_reviews.text: When I sleep without anything in this cot, my back hurts. You can feel the comfort of your back at the same time by placing an air pad on top. It is easy to install, durable, and very satisfying because cold air does not rise from below. It can be used comfortably when used in a tent larger than a small tent.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: While this is an extremely sturdy, and good sized cot, unfolding it can be a little cumbersome. I also did not like the fact that the outer legs did not lock into position. Setting this up inside of the tent might be slightly difficult. But overall this is an exceptional cot, and I would recommend it, and even possibly buy more if needed. Will never use the cup holder/side table, but it is a neat novelty, and looks cool in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: LC 66 Blue

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Large enough for a man 6'7" and perfectly sized for someone 5'4". Easy assembly (just pull out of bag, voila!) and solid construction in the frame. Lightweight and slender profile for storage. Decently comfortable as a stand alone- but I would recommend adding an air mattress or pad for uses longer than a day or two, in order to save your back. Great purchase to have on hand for overnight guests, camping and beach days as a bench for two.
customer_reviews.author: Analog Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and easy to fold
customer_reviews.text: I use this for all the time for camping and I love how quickly I can get it set up. I usually put a thin blanket under my sleeping bag and it’s just and comfortable as my mattress at home.
customer_reviews.author: Eriq T.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Room
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE. If you are a taller person, I'd say that you will be just fine. I'm 5'5" and I have plenty of room to spare. It is also nice and wide. I agree with some other reviews in that the legs do not lock at all. While this made me a little apprehensive, I had faith in science and went for it. I have no fear of it collapsing. The table is a great addition as well. This is not to be carried up a winding mountain trail. Its sturdiness is certainly in the weight of the materials.
customer_reviews.author: Dalikah

customer_reviews.title: Was comfy
customer_reviews.text: Used for about three weeks straight in the desert. Was heavy, squeaky, and started to sag a bit; but I weigh 260 so your experience may differ. Other than that it worked fine. The table part was a plus. Would I buy it again? I would look for something better first, but maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M

customer_reviews.title: I Am Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This cot was great when I went camping this past weekend! It is a tiny bit lower than I would like, but that is just nit picking. I am 185lbs and it held up great. No sag. I thought the side table would be weak, but it was not. I am impressed, well as impressed as you can be with a cot. ;-) I used thewith it and had the best nights sleep I can ever remember camping.
customer_reviews.author: wtbates

product_meta.title: Coleman Camping Cot with Side Table | Pack Away Folding Cot with Table and Cup Holder
product_meta.description: Color:GreenTake comfort and camping to a whole new level with the Coleman Pack-Away Camping Cot. The removable side table keeps drinks, lanterns, and other essentials within easy reach. The included carry bag makes it easy to transport and store.
feature_bullets: SIDE TABLE: Removable design with cup holder
ROOMY DESIGN: Fits campers up to 6 ft. 6 in.; 80 x 32 in. for extra sleeping room
BUILT TO LAST: Strong steel frame supports up to 300 lb.
CARRY BAG: Included for easy storage
Adjustable camping cot offers an ideal place for sitting, reclining, and sleeping

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
